data.title: ANTS
data.statement:
Automatic Nanobot Transfering System (ANTS) is a complex system featuring [[n]] nanobots walking on a 1-dimensional working lane with a length [[w]] meters.

Each nanobot initially starts at position [[m]] meters from the left end of the working lane, and is facing a direction [[d]], which can be either {{L}} (left) or {{R}} (right).

Once the system starts, each nanobot will travel at one meter per second in the direction it's facing. If at any point in time, two nanobots collide with one another, the nanobot that's facing left will face right, and the nanobot that's facing right will face left. The nanobots' widths are negligible.

Once a nanobot goes beyond either end of the working lane, it stops moving immediately.

Find the time taken in seconds for all nanobots to stop moving, rounded to the nearest integer.
data.constraints:
1 <= [[n]], [[w]] <= 100
0 <= [[m]] <= [[w]]
No two nanobots share the same initial position.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int w:int
loopline n m:int
read r:string(n)
write ANTS Corp.
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Two integers [[n]] and [[w]], separated by a space, representing the total number of nanobots and the working lane's length, respectively.
<<Line 2:>> [[n]] space-separated integers [[m]], representing the positions of the nanobots in meters.
<<Line 3:>> [[n]] characters, either {{L}} or {{R}}, representing the direction of the nanobots given in the exact same order as in Line 2.
data.outputDescription: The time taken in seconds for all nanobots to stop moving.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Automatic Nanobot Transfering System (ANTS) is a complex system featuring n nanobots walking on a 1-dimensional working lane with a length w meters.

Each nanobot initially starts at position m meters from the left end of the working lane, and is facing a direction d, which can be either L (left) or R (right).

Once the system starts, each nanobot will travel at one meter per second in the direction it's facing. If at any point in time, two nanobots collide with one another, the nanobot that's facing left will face right, and the nanobot that's facing right will face left. The nanobots' widths are negligible.

Once a nanobot goes beyond either end of the working lane, it stops moving immediately.

Find the time taken in seconds for all nanobots to stop moving, rounded to the nearest integer.
Input
Line 1: Two integers n and w, separated by a space, representing the total number of nanobots and the working lane's length, respectively.
Line 2: n space-separated integers m, representing the positions of the nanobots in meters.
Line 3: n characters, either L or R, representing the direction of the nanobots given in the exact same order as in Line 2.
Output
The time taken in seconds for all nanobots to stop moving.
Constraints
1 <= n, w <= 100
0 <= m <= w
No two nanobots share the same initial position.
Example
Input
5 4
0 1 2 3 4
LLRRL
Output
4
